com.github.naoghuman.lib.i18n.core

Interface I18NResourceBundle

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultI18NResourceBundle, I18NFacade

    public interface I18NResourceBundle
    This Interface allowed the developer to managed following tasks:
    Configuration from the ResourceBundle:
    • Setting the base bundle name for the ResourceBundle.
    • Setting the supported Locales.
    • Setting the default Locale.
    • and last setting the actual Locale.

    Access to the ResourceBundle:

    • Return directly the value from a given key as String.
    • or inject additional arguments into the message with MessageFormat.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...).
    Since:
    0.1.0-PRERELEASE
    Version:
    0.6.0
    Author:
    Naoghuman
    See Also:
    Object, String, MessageFormat.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...), Locale, ResourceBundle

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseBundleName

        String getBaseBundleName()
        Returns the baseBundleName from the associated ResourceBundle.
        Returns:
        the baseBundleName from the ResourceBundle.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        ResourceBundle

      • setBaseBundleName

        void setBaseBundleName(String baseBundleName)
        Sets the baseBundleName which will be used to load the associated ResourceBundle.

        Format from the baseBundleName should be:

        • Package name to the bundle, '.' (point) separated.
        • Base name from the bundles.

        Example:

        • Package: com.github.naoghuman.app.i18n.demo
        • Bundles: message_de.properties, message_en.properties
        • Base bundle name: com.github.naoghuman.app.i18n.demo.message
        Parameters:
        baseBundleName - the base bundle name.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if baseBundleName is NULL.
        IllegalArgumentException - if baseBundleName is EMPTY.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE

      • getMessage

        String getMessage(String key)
        Returns the associated value from the given key depending from the actual Locale.

        Before the access to the value will be performed an internal check will be done if a ResourceBundle with the acutal parameters baseBundleName and actualLocale can be loaded. If not a MissingResourceException will be thrown.

        Hint:
        If the key can't be found in the existing ResourceBundle then the pattern '<key>' will be returned.

        Parameters:
        key - which value should be loaded.
        Returns:
        the associated value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key is EMPTY.
        NullPointerException - if key is NULL.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        actualLocaleProperty(), Locale, MissingResourceException, ResourceBundle

      • getMessage

        String getMessage(String key,
                  Object... arguments)
        Returns the associated value (with the injected arguments) from the given key depending from the actual Locale.

        Before the access to the value will be performed an internal check will be done if a ResourceBundle with the acutal parameters baseBundleName and actualLocale can be loaded. If not a MissingResourceException will be thrown.

        For the injecting from the arguments into the value from the ResourceBundle the class MessageFormat.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) will be used to format the returned message.

        Hint:
        If the key can't be found in the existing ResourceBundle then the pattern '<key>' will be returned.

        Parameters:
        key - which value should be loaded.
        arguments - which should be injected into the associated value.
        Returns:
        the associated value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if (key || arguments) is EMPTY.
        NullPointerException - if (key || arguments) is NULL.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        actualLocaleProperty(), MessageFormat.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...), Locale, MissingResourceException, ResourceBundle

      • getDefaultLocale

        Locale getDefaultLocale()
        Returns the default Locale.
        Returns:
        the default Locale.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        Locale

      • setDefaultLocale

        void setDefaultLocale(Locale locale)
        Sets the default Locale.

        If the supported Locales doesn't contained the default Locale then the Locale.ENGLISH will be used instead.

        Parameters:
        locale - the new default Locale.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if locale is NULL.
        IllegalArgumentException - if locale is EMPTY.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        setSupportedLocales(javafx.collections.ObservableList), Locale, Locale.ENGLISH

      • setActualLocale

        void setActualLocale(Locale locale)
        Sets the actual Locale.

        If the supported Locales doesn't contained the actual Locale then the default Locale will be used instead.

        Parameters:
        locale - the new actual Locale.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if locale is NULL.
        IllegalArgumentException - if locale is EMPTY.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        getDefaultLocale(), Locale

      • actualLocaleProperty

        javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<Locale> actualLocaleProperty()
        Returns the actual Locale as a ObjectProperty.

        The ObjectProperty allowed during the update from the actual Locale that all binded texts will be automatically updated.

        Returns:
        the actual Locale as a ObjectProperty.
        Since:
        0.1.0-PRERELEASE
        See Also:
        Locale, ObjectProperty
